Articles.Content:
Hellow, fellow Kerbals!

Today I've observed strange bug: all tanks of all my vessels in game suddently were refilled up to maximum capacity. It was quite convenient, by the way, saved me costs of resupply ship ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Anybody know this bug?

MODS:

MechJeb,

ContractConfigurator,

DMagic Orbital Science

Firespitter fuel switch,

Rasterprop monitors,

Waypoint manager.

> 
> Hellow, fellow Kerbals!
> Today I've observed strange bug: all tanks of all my vessels in game suddently were refilled up to maximum capacity. It was quite convenient, by the way, saved me costs of resupply ship ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> 
> Anybody know this bug?
> 
> MODS:
> 
> MechJeb,
> 
> ContractConfigurator,
> 
> DMagic Orbital Science
> 
> Firespitter fuel switch,
> 
> Rasterprop monitors,
> 
> Waypoint manager.

Happened to me when I switched from firespitter to *interstellar* fuel switch.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-21T18:00:20Z" title="05/21/2015 06:00  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 21, 2015</time> by Randazzo**

This just happened to me too. Did we work out why this happened?

As above - the only mod that seems to the same is Firespitter. Any clues to avoid this in the future would be appreciated. Peace.

MODS

AntennaRange

AsteroidDay

BouldCo

Chatterer

ColorCodedCans

EngineLight

EVE

Firespitter

HabitatPack

HullCameraVDS

KerbalEngineer

KerbalTeck

kOS

KronalUtils

LayeredAnimations

Magic Smoke Industries

Mk2Expansion

MSD

PlanetaryBaseInc

Planetshine

RCSBuildAid

SETIgreenhouse

StockNoContracts

Texture Replacer

THunderAerospace

TaodicusToools

TiggerTech

UberDyneAsternautics

WildBlueIndustries

I think it was a Fuel Switcher issue. When I upgraded ColorCodedCans, the newer version had added Fuel Switching to it. A combination of dated KAC backups and seeing when I updated the mod, reverting back both the mod and renaming the persistance file saved the day (and a few hours of progress!)

Peace.
